# listGroupedHeaderFooter()

**Type Method**

Creates the default configuration you use to style a grouped list header or footer.

## Declaration

```swift
static func listGroupedHeaderFooter() -> UIBackgroundConfiguration
```

## Return Value

The default configuration for a grouped list header or footer.

## Discussion

Create this configuration to update the styling for the background of a header or footer in a table view or collection view list. When you apply this configuration, the background of the header or footer matches the system default styling for a header or footer in a grouped list.

For an appearance consistent with system defaults, use this background configuration for a header or footer in these contexts:

- A table view that you configure with the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/Style-swift.enum/grouped] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/Style-swift.enum/insetGrouped] enumeration cases.
- A a collection view list that you configure with the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICollectionLayoutListConfiguration-swift.struct/Appearance-swift.enum/grouped] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICollectionLayoutListConfiguration-swift.struct/Appearance-swift.enum/insetGrouped] enumeration cases.

## Creating header and footer background configurations

- **listPlainHeaderFooter()**: Creates the default configuration you use to style a plain list header or footer.
- **listSidebarHeader()**: Creates the default configuration you use to style a sidebar list header.
